intro: Sericocoma chrysurus, commonly known as the golden hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, hair-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, such as meadows and wetlands. Its flowers are usually yellow or golden in color, contributing to its common name. Sericocoma chrysurus plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
